videos.title: 🧠 Go Interview Q: How to Close Files Properly using `defer` 🔐
videos.description:
📌 In this Go interview prep video, learn how to use the `defer` statement to handle file closing like a pro!

👨‍💻 What you'll learn:
- Real-world use of `defer` for resource cleanup
- Why closing files is essential in Go
- Common mistakes to avoid during file handling

📂 Code Example: `os.Open()` + `defer file.Close()`

📚 Perfect for: Beginners, Job Seekers, Go Developers

#golang #interviewprep #goprogramming #defer #filehandling #codeexample #learnprogramming
videos.playlistName: Golang Interview Shorts 🔥 | 1 Go Qn a Day | Crack Interviews Fast

videos.title: 🔁 Go Defer Execution Order Explained with Fun Example 🧩
videos.description:
💡 Learn how Go executes deferred statements in reverse order — a common topic in interviews!

🛠️ What’s covered:
- Multiple `defer` usage
- Stack-like behavior of `defer`
- Step-by-step printed output

✅ Real-life analogy + code walkthrough included

📌 Example Output:
- Now in main function
- Third
- Second
- First

#golang #gointerview #deferorder #programmingtips #stackbehavior #golangtricks #devlife

videos.title: 💥 Recover from Panic in Go using `defer`! | Must-Know for Interviews ⚠️
videos.description:
🚨 Ever seen a Go program crash? Learn how to recover gracefully from panic using `defer` and `recover()`.

🔥 In this video:
- `panic()` vs `recover()`
- Why deferred functions are perfect for recovery
- How to avoid crashing your Go apps

🧪 Example used: Simulating a crash and recovering from it

✅ Ideal for backend devs & job interviews

#golang #panic #recover #defer #golanginterview #errorhandling #backenddeveloper #goquestions #goprogramming
